parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
Elijah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Helias, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To talk with, discuss. From sun and laleo; to talk together, i.e. Converse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
